sourceComments:
[A: Are you ok? B:] A- Ah... It' s nothing.

betsu ni occurs frequently, with slightly different meanings. It's often used to avoid a clear answer, like above. It can also mean: "I don't care". Have a look at the ref I added. This btw. is another example for the whitespace issue: It's actually betsu + ni, but often taught as single word.

sambonjuku explains this well, but also admits that it's difficult. This channel is already on the video mining list, but this particular video is still way too difficult. I will make sure that it's added to the jlab video list though, so don't worry if you don't fully understand betsu ni for now.

Uh, adding the betsu and betsu ni cards (4 in total) just took me almost one hour, mining at this slow speed is sometimes not fun. At least I hope it makes learning faster for you!
